data.decision: All future design work will follow the DURO Design Operating System: Start with Intent (mood sentence + palette), then Composition (hierarchy + grid + intentional discord), then Behavior (motion with purpose). Use the 10-point runbook checklist. Apply the 6-point critique scorecard to evaluate. Never skip Layer 1 - if the mood/palette doesn't work, nothing else matters.
data.rationale: User elevated the Abstract-to-Digital framework into a complete operating system with three layers, a reusable runbook, and an objective scorecard. This transforms "taste" into trainable methodology. The cultural correction on color-emotion makes the framework more bulletproof.
alternatives: Continue using principles as unstructured toolkit
Apply principles ad-hoc based on intuition
Skip the intent layer and jump straight to composition
data.context: User teaching moment - elevating my design framework into production-ready operating system
